children.subject:
P.S.

I've had a number of Data 8 students come talk to me and there seems to be a misconception about how the enrollment system works.

For enrollment purposes, the LECTURE is the enrollment component of the class. Your wait list position is based on the date/time you attempt to enroll into the lecture. 

Lab sections are secondary components. The system may show you your wait list position for the lab simply to give you an idea of your odds of getting into that section. 

Enrollments are handled as a CLASS (lecture plus lab). It's not possible to be enrolled in the lab & not in the lecture or to be enrolled in the lecture but remain wait listed for a lab. 

When the wait list is processed, the system looks @ the first person on the LECTURE WL. If there is space in the lab section they selected and the lecture, they will be moved into the class. If not, the system goes to the second person on the LECTURE WL and runs the same check.

history.content:
Unfortunately, we are unable to accommodate everyone who wanted to enroll in Data 8 this semester and there is no chance that we will expand the class enrollment further.  In an effort to accurately set expectations for students, we have closed the wait list and have trimmed it to the first 200 people on the wait list. 

For those of you who were bumped from the wait list and those who wanted to join the wait list but could not, we know this situation is disappointing but felt it was better to redirect you to other classes now while there is still time to make other plans before classes begin. We hope you will try to enroll again in SP20.

If you remain wait listed, the wait list will automatically fill any available seats when it runs 6 times daily. Please monitor your wait list position and be prepared to pursue a back up plan. Remaining on the wait list at this time simply means there is a chance you will get into the class - this is not a guarantee that you will be enrolled.
history.subject: F19 CS C8: Wait list is now closed
